notesStmt.note: Aharon ben Nezer ben Ezra᾿ ben Mosheh: inscribed, folio 179r. Melekh Al-avad Al-aziz ibn Firūz: inscribed, folio 178v-179r.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A fragment of Judeo-Arabic commentary of Japheth ben Ali ha-Levi on Leviticus (21-24).

collation.p: 18 quires of 10 leaves each (except the first which has 9 leaves and the last which has 11 leaves).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Square and semi-cursive script of 15th century.

binding.p: Post-1600. Black buckram. Gold-tooled spine. Spine: 'Yefet. Commentary on Leviticus. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2399.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 08 July 1882, folio [180v].
